newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Philips to sell 50 pct stake in UPC.
newsitem.headline: Philips to sell 50 pct stake in UPC.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV said it planned to sell its 50 pct stake in United and Philips Communications BV (UPC) to United International Holdings Inc. of Denver, Colorado.
Philips said the sale would raise gross proceeds of approximately 800 million guilders ($424.6 million) for Philips. ($ = 1.884 Dutch Guilders)
The company said, of this amount, 308 million guilders would be in the form of new securities, issued by UPC.

It said the securities would be in a form which would permit their sale by Philips in the secondary market after the closing of the deal, which is expected to take place in the third quarter of this year.

"As is widely known, Philips is currently reviewing its portfolio of activities. As a result, the company has concluded that its cable TV operation is not a core activity," said President and CEO of Philips Media Richard de Lange.
